events.message: The customer filed a claim after their vehicle was involved in a collision on Main Street, with moderate front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident due to the keywords indicating a vehicle collision and accident.
An agent with expertise in auto accident claims was assigned promptly to handle the case and support the customer.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process would proceed without delay.
Additional documents requested including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from the customer.
The customer submitted all required documents, including detailed photos of the collision damage and the official police report.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documentation and contacted witnesses to better understand the collision circumstances.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the vehicle damage estimate was verified as accurate.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant, covering the full cost of repairs and rental car reimbursement during the vehicleâ€™s downtime.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the timely communication from their assigned agent.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department, confirming all terms of the settlement and repair coverage.
Settlement payment was disbursed to the repair shop and rental agency as agreed in the approved claim terms.
The claim was formally closed following successful payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the customer.
